result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carly A Mengeling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carly A Mengeling in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail to be applied to 15CT1051
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Carly A Mengeling
Current: 8601 West Crawford Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53228 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2016)
Prior: 2520 S 29th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Carly A Mengeling in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into 15CT1051. Bail to be applied to case #15CT1051.  Calendar call scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Court ordered $1,000.00 to be refunded to poster.   $500.00 bail to remain on case.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring within 1 business day of posting or bailing out of jail.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.

Defendant Carly A Mengeling in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lebell did not know about this charge.  State gives attorney Lebell the complaint in court.  Court reads the complaint.  Attorney Lebell waives formal reading and enters a NOT GUILTY plea.  State requests cashbail.  Attorney Lebell makes statements requesting a signature bond.  Court sets cashbail in the amount of $500.00.  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
